title.narrative: KMSS and Santa Marta Group Anti-trafficking Meeting January 2020

description.narrative:
KMSS and the Santa Marta Group are holding a 4 day meeting in January 2020 focused on the Church's response to trafficking and unsafe migration in Asia. The meeting will be attended by senior Church officials, including Cardinal Vincent Nichols and Cardinal Bo, Myanmar Government representatives, various experts in the field of trafficking, migration and human rights, and survivors of trafficking/unsafe migration. The meeting will cover the following issues:
- the current challenges in tackling trafficking/unsafe migration and the Church's response to date - the role of international law and international organisations - how Asian governments should tackle trafficking/unsafe migration at a policy/strategic level and how the Church should engage with this.
Migration is a key issue for CAFOD's work in Asia and this meeting will provide a platform for various stakeholders to share learning and have crucial discussions around how best to tackle these issues in a coordinated and strategic way. CAFOD has therefore agreed to provide funding towards the running costs of this meeting from the Asia Regional budget.
For background on KMSS' work on anti-trafficking and safe migration please see project ID BUR155 and MYA208 which CAFOD funded from 2014 - 2019.
